# disambiguation(with:)

**Type Method**

Creates an object whose resolution requires the user to select from among the specified objects.

## Declaration

```swift
class func disambiguation(with restaurantsToDisambiguate: [INRestaurant]) -> Self
```

## Parameters

- **restaurantsToDisambiguate**: An array of restaurants from which to select. Specify as few items as possible, and preferably no more than five.

## Return Value

A new [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRestaurantResolutionResult] object.

## Discussion

Use this method when you cannot resolve the restaurant uniquely and need the user to select from a limited set of possible values.

## Creating a Resolution Result Object

- **success(with:)**: Creates an object whose resolution involves the successful matching of the specified parameter.
- **confirmationRequired(with:)**: Creates an object whose resolution requires that the user must confirm the value before proceeding.

items.description: Creates an object whose resolution involves the successful matching of the specified parameter.
